articles.title: Top News Headlines Today: September 3, 2025
articles.description: Key headlines include Prime Minister Modi unveiling India's first semiconductor chip, the Yamuna River crossing a danger mark in Delhi, and a suicide bombing in Quetta, Pakistan. Other news includes a court rejecting bail for Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, and UPI reaching a record 20 billion transactions in August.

articles.title: This Morning's Top Headlines â€“ Sept. 3
articles.description: A federal appeals court blocked the Trump administration's effort to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members. President Trump announced a US strike on a vessel in the Caribbean carrying drugs from Venezuela. The House committee investigating Jeffrey Epstein released more files related to the case.

articles.title: Top news of the day: September 3, 2025
articles.description: Opposition-ruled states argued in the Supreme Court that Governors have no role in lawmaking. Russia launched over 500 drones and missiles at Ukraine overnight. The Bombay High Court asked activist Manoj Jarange Patil to clarify his role in damages during the Maratha quota stir.
